name: Cubic Millimeter
intro: Microscopic volume unit, suitable for measuring the volume of precision parts, biological cells, and micro-reagents.

name: Cubic Centimeter
intro: Unit for small containers/reagents, adapted for volume measurement of cosmetics, pharmaceutical reagents, and jewelry (equivalent to milliliters).

name: Cubic Decimeter
intro: Medium volume unit, mostly used for measuring household containers, liquid raw materials, and small storage spaces.

name: Cubic Meter
intro: International benchmark unit of volume, the core measurement standard for construction, logistics, water conservancy, and industrial warehousing.

name: Cubic Kilometer
intro: Ultra-large-scale volume unit, suitable for describing the volume of lakes, reservoirs, oilfields, and geological structures.

name: Milliliter
intro: Core unit for daily liquids, the mainstream measurement standard for beverages, medicines, cosmetics, and condiments.

name: Liter
intro: Mainstream metric unit for liquids, adapted for volume measurement of drinking water, fuel oil, and food processing raw materials.

name: Cubic Inch
intro: Unit for small components in the UK and US, mostly used for measuring the volume of mechanical parts, hardware accessories, and small containers.

name: Cubic Foot
intro: Core unit for construction and warehousing in the UK and US, adapted for measuring the volume of housing space, containers, and storage rooms.

name: Cubic Yard
intro: Unit for engineering and logistics in the UK and US, mostly used for measuring earthwork projects, building material transportation, and garbage removal.

name: US Fluid Ounce
intro: Small liquid unit in the United States, suitable for measurement scenarios of beverages, condiments, cosmetics, and pharmaceutical preparations.

name: US Gallon
intro: Mainstream liquid unit in the United States, the core measurement standard for fuel oil, drinking water, and chemical raw materials.

name: US Quart
intro: Medium liquid unit in the United States, adapted for batch measurement of milk, edible oil, and industrial reagents.

name: US Pint
intro: Daily liquid unit in the United States, mostly used for retail measurement of dairy products, alcoholic beverages, and condiments.

name: US Cup
intro: Specialized unit for cooking in the United States, a standardized measuring tool for baking and catering ingredients.

name: US Tablespoon
intro: Small cooking unit in the United States, adapted for precise measurement of sauces, edible oil, and spices.

name: US Teaspoon
intro: Micro cooking unit in the United States, mostly used for precise measurement of salt, sugar, and condiments.

name: UK Fluid Ounce
intro: Small liquid unit in the UK and Commonwealth countries, suitable for measurement of beverages, medicines, and cosmetics.

name: UK Gallon
intro: Mainstream liquid unit in the UK and Commonwealth countries, the measurement standard for fuel oil, chemicals, and agricultural irrigation.

name: UK Quart
intro: Medium liquid unit in the UK, adapted for batch measurement of dairy products, alcoholic beverages, and industrial raw materials.

name: UK Pint
intro: Daily liquid unit in the UK, the core standard for retail measurement of beer, milk, and beverages.

name: Chinese He
intro: Traditional small volume unit in China, mostly used for small-quantity measurement of traditional grain, oil, and alcoholic drinks.

name: Chinese Sheng
intro: Core traditional volume unit in China, adapted for traditional measurement scenarios of grain, oil, alcoholic drinks, and agricultural materials.

name: Chinese Dou
intro: Traditional medium volume unit in China, mostly used for batch measurement of grain and agricultural materials.

name: Chinese Dan
intro: Traditional bulk volume unit in China, suitable for batch trading measurement of grain, oil, and other agricultural products.

name: Scheffel (Germany)
intro: Traditional volume unit in Germany, mostly used for batch measurement of grain, feed, and alcoholic drinks.

name: Muid (France)
intro: Traditional bulk volume unit in France, adapted for batch measurement of wine, grain, and building materials.

name: French Pinte
intro: Daily liquid unit in France, mostly used for retail measurement of wine, beverages, and dairy products.

name: Vedro (Russia)
intro: Traditional liquid unit in Russia, suitable for measurement scenarios of vodka, drinking water, and fuel oil.

name: Barile (Italy)
intro: Traditional volume unit in Italy, mostly used for batch trading measurement of olive oil and wine.

name: Khok (India)
intro: Traditional volume unit in India, adapted for daily measurement of grain, edible oil, and drinking water.

name: Sao (Thailand)
intro: Traditional volume unit in Thailand, mostly used for batch measurement of rice, agricultural materials, and drinking water.

name: Gelas (Indonesia)
intro: Daily small volume unit in Indonesia, suitable for measurement scenarios of beverages, tea, and condiments.

name: Sa'ah (Saudi Arabia)
intro: Traditional unit in Saudi Arabia, mostly used for batch measurement of water, oil, and grain.

name: Ardeb (Egypt)
intro: Core agricultural unit in Egypt, adapted for batch measurement of wheat, corn, cotton, and other agricultural products.

name: Fanega (Mexico)
intro: Traditional agricultural unit in Mexico, mostly used for batch measurement of corn, beans, and grain.

name: Alqueire (Brazil)
intro: Bulk agricultural unit in Brazil, suitable for measurement scenarios of coffee, soybeans, sugarcane, and other agricultural products.

name: Bag (South Africa)
intro: General volume unit in South Africa, mostly used for batch measurement of grain, cement, and chemical fertilizers.
